intro: Monachosorella maximowiczii, commonly known as the rock spirogyra, is a freshwater green alga belonging to the family Zygnemataceae. It is characterized by its filamentous structure composed of unbranched, ribbon-like cells. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous environments such as on rocks or in shallow water. Its cells are often arranged in a helical or spiral pattern, which is a distinctive feature of the genus Monachosorella. It plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to primary production and serving as a food source for various microorganisms.
